 The "castle doctrine" is part of the legal self defense argument. It is a small part of the overall law of self defense which permits use of force, to include deadly force when reasonably necessary, to defend your home and its curtilage. In Virginia it is a hybrid doctrine which provides an exception to the general rule that you are not allowed to use or even threaten the use of deadly force to defend property. For example, if you walk upon someone breaking into your car in a parking lot you are not allowed to run them off by pulling a knife or a gun and threatening to shoot them, although I suspect threatening the use of deadly force to defend personal property happens regularly.
 
 The answer to the question of do I think the laws are right assumes you meant the laws I outlined for self-defense in Virginia. If so, then I believe all of them are proper and have withstood the test of time. The reasons I think they are proper could prove lengthy and if we want to have this discussion then I request you pick one aspect of the self-defense framework and ask specifically about that one. 
 
 The instruction you cite back may sound like equating weapons to you, and I can see how the language is susceptible to that interpretation. But at the old common law "reasonable in relation to the harm threatened" meant no use of deadly force unless threatened with death or great bodily harm. As an extreme example-shooting a child who threatens you with a willow switch would not be a use of force "reasonable in relation to the harm threatened." 
 
 200+ years of courts applying this standard in my state have consistently held that there is no equating of deadly weapons. Once a deadly weapon of any type is used to threaten then any deadly weapon at hand may be used in either self-defense or defense of others. There is no requirement that a person carry every possible means of defensive weapon because he must only meet a knife with a knife, a bat with a bat, a revolver with a revolver, etc. To do so would either gut the feasibility of exercising self defense or in the alternative require everyone to go around bristling with several weapons like Mad Max.
